intro: Gymnolomia ovata, commonly known as the oval leaf gymnolomia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its simple, ovate-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Gymnolomia ovata is often found in shaded, moist forest understories where it thrives in humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
